Key Match Events: England vs Scotland match was abandoned due to rain after just ten overs of play.
Scotland made 90/0 in a rain-shortened 10-over innings.
George Munsey was reprieved after being hurried by a Mark Wood delivery and top-edging a high catch to Jos Buttler, but the delivery was called a no-ball.
Michael Jones hit a huge six into the roof of the Kensington Oval to help take Chris Jordan’s first over for 15 runs.
Scotland's George Munsey unfurled a remarkable reverse hit off Adil Rashid to send the ball into the stands in the rain-shortened game against England.
Pre-Game Insights: England are defending champions and have the boost of including a fit-again Jofra Archer in their squad for the tournament.
England have never beaten a European side at a Men’s T20 World Cup.
Scotland will be rueing a missed opportunity to defend their decent total, and will hope to get a win on the board when they face Namibia on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Kensington Oval in Barbados.
The game was reduced to a 10-over contest upon its resumption due to rain.
England's next game comes on Saturday against Australia at the same venue.
Scotland will face Namibia on Thursday.
Others: Jofra Archer and Mark Wood were bowled out in the rain-shortened game.
Adil Rashid had one expensive over in the mini-session.
The fans at the Kensington Oval were treated to one shortened innings.
